file_content.text: You're welcome to stay as a guest for as long as you want.
My lord--you're back. I wasn't expecting you to be so quick.
Your power is impressive even among the Sith.
Well, look who's back. I was afraid we'd lost you to that Czerka tomb.
It's good to see you alive.
I'm sure you want to rest up, but I'd like to hear--did you find the artifacts?
Inside this device is an alien mind. It was responsible for the destruction of Czerka. It says it wants to work with us.
This alien box will explain.
There's an intelligence stored in there? That's--just incredible. Heh. That's amazing.
We can do an initial study here, but a find like this has to go to Dromund Kaas....
This device was all I found. Lock it away. Don't touch it. Don't think about it.
Never open this thing.
I appreciate your caution, but it's not my decision to make. I'll pass the advice on to the Science Bureau.
Regardless, this is amazing work.
I found this device, but I don't know what's inside.
One mystery artifact, is all.
Incredible. This is the thing Czerka died for, and now it's ours.
We'll do an initial study here, but the Science Bureau will want it shipped to Dromund Kaas. Still....
You've turned this expedition around. After our losses, I didn't think I'd be filing a mission report--let alone declaring victory.
I understand your excitement, but don't take that thing lightly.
Be careful.
Given what happened with Czerka... we'll proceed with caution.
Between the mutations and the desert, I had doubts as well.
We almost didn't survive.
I never thought you'd say that.
If I hadn't come along, you'd still be searching for Czerka's droids.
All thanks to me.
And maybe we wouldn't have found the Jawas and activated that first artifact. It's hard to say.
I found a creature--a "Rakata"--trapped in one of the devices. It's been buried under the desert all this time.
Along with their alien maker.
Could you communicate with the creature? Is it--can we talk to it?
I didn't have any choice. It tried to kill me. I destroyed it.
I'm sorry, but it attacked me.
Apparently, twenty thousand years of isolation can drive a creature mad. I had to destroy it.
It was insane.
The alien was too dangerous to live. I had to destroy it.
Not anymore.
I understand. I've heard stories. Service members discover ancient droids, lost colonies... it never ends well.
I found them, but they had to be destroyed.
I blew the artifacts up.
Blast. Were they really that dangerous? You couldn't have contained them?
Sorry. Stupid question.
Looks like Czerka cleaned the place out.
The base was empty.
Blast. After all that? We'll have to go in ourselves, take the place apart panel by panel.
Still, we've got one artifact, and there's always Czerka's records. It's a victory, if not one for the history books.
With Darth Silthar gone, I'm in charge. You ever need our help... you know where to find me.
I've had an interesting time here, Captain. Maybe we'll do it again some day.
It's good to work with you.
Maybe we will, at that.
You're not without skill, Captain. I'll remember your offer.
You may be useful to me.
You're too kind, my lord.
What about the rest of the team?
And your crew?
Hael's being reassigned to Korriban--Darth Silthar's last request. I don't know about the others, but we won't be a group anymore.
I'll be surprised if Mos Ila is still standing in a month.
You're hardly qualified.
I'll see what I can do to avoid that.
Safe journeys out there. And be careful--this galaxy has a lot of old secrets.
Once you start seeing them... they tend to start looking back.
Signal the probe droid once you're in the natives' sacred land. Make sure nothing harms it.
I think we have it, sir. The natives' forbidden zone is in sector 22-G. I can start outfitting a probe immediately.
To make this work, you'll need to protect a droid during its scanning circuit until it finds the Czerka base.
Anything approaching the droid will die by my hands.
I'll fight whatever I must.
Make sure your droid works. I'll ensure its protection.
Oh, I can do that.
I believe you. The word of a Sith isn't something to take lightly.
Protect a droid? I've done much worse to acquire information.
How very quaint.
Bodyguarding isn't my usual line of work--but I'll manage.
Protection? Okay.
Very well.
Remind me to hunt down whoever designed those things.
Not much of a droid.
I'm told they're not meant to operate on a sunburnt rock like this. Hard to argue.
Once you're in position, use this signal device to call the droid. It'll launch from here.
In the meantime, we've got friends to bury.
Are the power readings stable?
Yes, sir. The stasis field's online.
Keep it that way. I don't want the artifact powering up again.
You're looking alright. You caught up with that monster?
The ghosts of the desert live no more.
Situation is under control.
No problem.
I'll take that as an affirmative. And--I'm glad you could spare the village. No one deserves that.
The Sons of Palawa are safe, and the infected have been destroyed. Mission accomplished.
I saved the settlement.
You don't know how glad I am to hear that.
I heard the explosion--I take it the contamination site's been cleared?
The Sons of Palawa village is no more.
That's correct.
Be more careful with your artifacts next time.
It's all your fault, you know.
You have no idea the precautions we took. This is what we do, it just... wasn't enough.
The screams, the fires--beautiful stuff.
It was wonderful!
It's a pity. Even tribals don't deserve to be obliterated because of some... alien relic.
Those artifacts Czerka found... they must be capable of infecting people. Transforming them. I don't know why you'd build a device like that.
But some species did, long before humans lived on Tatooine. And the Reclamation Service has the job of bringing those artifacts home. Are you with us?
Where Darth Silthar failed, I will succeed.
I'll show you how it's done.
I've recovered more dangerous artifacts than you ever will. This won't be difficult.
I'll show you how it's done.
As you say, my lord. Without a Sith on the expedition, we'd be... at a loss, I'm sure.
Intelligence has an interest in seeing those artifacts recovered. I'm in.
It's my duty.
Right. And so long as Intelligence is looking over our shoulder, the expedition will continue.
I start a job, I see it through.
Absolutely.
I respect that. I could say the same thing, but for different reasons--the Empire kills deserters.
Sounds like you've got your fire back, Captain.
You seem energized.
I had my moment of doubt. I saw Keighlah, Perrin and Bann die because of it.
And get myself killed?
You've done very well at keeping yourself alive so far.
What we just experienced--the artifact powering on, the takeover--I'm willing to bet Czerka went through the same thing.
If we knew where to start looking for Czerka's base, we could scan for the artifact's power signal, track down the laboratory. Too bad Silthar didn't get more data.
The base is in the Sand People's cursed land. These drawings should show the way.
I know where to go.
Before he died, Silthar explained his plans. We have all the data we need.
He figured it all out.
You give the old man too much credit. You've got me now.
Who needs Silthar?
What are you talking about? What do you have there?
This--it's primitive, but it looks like a native map. We'll check its age, calculate the geographical changes since its creation....
Get to the settlement. We have to stop the contamination before it spreads.
Blast. We'll mourn later. You remember the Sons of Palawa?
You hit them hard in Mos Ila, but their main village is just a few klicks out. If that creature reaches them, this could get very ugly.
The Sons of Palawa can handle themselves.
They aren't exactly helpless.
Not if they don't know what they're facing.
Oh?
Let our enemies destroy one another.
Not our problem.
Under other circumstances, maybe. Not now.
Basic rule of xenoarchaeology: You don't unleash a foreign technology into a population center, especially one with a man-machine interface.
Worst case, the technology that changed Perrin could replicate--every person in the settlement could be transformed.
At last, a challenge worthy of me.
That could be quite a fight.
As you say, my lord.
Fools shouldn't meddle with what they don't understand.
You lost control of all this.
With due respect, my lord, we know what we're doing. There are risks to any excavation.
Technology like that could be very useful to the Empire.
A very useful weapon.
That's why we need to find Czerka. But right now, that tech isn't in a form we can study.
Guess I won't worry about running low on targets.
That could be quite a fight.
No. I guess you won't have to worry about that.
That's horrible!
I can't say I disagree. I'm not optimistic, though.
If it transforms them, so be it.
Let them die.
I don't care what your grudge is. We can't let an outbreak occur.
Reclamation Service protocol for contaminated sites mandates atomic heat-cleansing of everything within a hundred-meter radius.
We've got a store of baradium explosives for that purpose--enough to obliterate the Sons' cave village. But I hope it won't come to that.
What choice do we have?
Is there another way?
I'm not going to blow up a village full of people.
Murder isn't an option.
If you're lucky, maybe you can take out Perrin before he reaches the settlement.
Otherwise, plant the explosives--be careful with them!--around the caves. One way or another, the contamination has to be eliminated.
We should have destroyed the tribals long ago.
Oh, I'm using the bombs.
If you say so. Get to the caves. Maybe you'll catch Perrin before he's transformed a whole army.
Those creatures--they were my team.
Sir! I think Perrin escaped. He was heading into the desert--toward the tribal settlement.
Blast it. Don't let them escape into the desert!
Hael, check on Keighlah and the others. See if they've figured out anything with the artifact.
Sir, I'd like to hear what happened....
Follow orders. I'll brief everyone later.
I've sent for water and kolto, my lord--I'm sure the desert was agonizing.
You look--well, you look like you've been to the Dune Sea and back. I've sent for water and kolto.
But we've been waiting for word. Any sign of Darth Silthar?
He didn't make it. He fell to the Sand People and their servants.
Silthar is dead.
Your master was Sith until the end. It was a good death.
He died bravely.
Trust me, you don't want that man back.
You're better off without him.
So. He really didn't make it, then.
Damn it. We all felt it. But we weren't sure--we're not blasted Sith!
Without Silthar, we're just archaeologists with guns. Without him, this whole expedition falls apart.
Obey me, and you may yet survive this world.
I'm your only hope now.
Fall to pieces later. First, you'll help me obtain Czerka's secrets.
Not until I'm done with you.
Respectfully, my lord, I can't just turn my team over to you.
We are Imperials. We'll find a way to succeed.
Hold it together, Captain.
Inspiring, but not very practical.
Time you learned some self-reliance.
Well, get over it.
It isn't over yet. I know where to find the Czerka base.
I have data that'll help.
What are you talking about?
Too bad.
I guess since Silthar brought you into this, now you're out?
Captain Golah!
Blast, Hael--now's not the time.
The artifact--the one the Jawas found--it's got Keighlah. We disabled the dampeners, and there was a flash....
What...? Start containment procedures, now!
The Imprisoned One will be free. The rebirth has begun.
Captain Golah. Care to explain this?
What have you people done now?
I don't know. Keighlah? Are you in there?
This body is now a vessel for the Imprisoned One. This planet will become a vessel for his power.
Tell me about the Imprisoned One.
Talk to me, creature.
The Imprisoned One speaks from the white room. We are the manifestation of his glory.
Keighlah? Everyone, stay back.
Monstrous freak. [Attack]
You will fall before us. The expansion will continue.
Contact me from a holostation when you get out to the desert. There's something I'd like to follow up on.
I won't bore you with the science. Lord Silthar's on a pilgrimage, and we're getting ready to move to the forward research outpost--but we may need you again soon.
This mission isn't over. I'd like to see it through.
Name the place and time.
Captain--you're holding something back.
What aren't you telling me?
Nothing actionable. You'll know anything as soon as I do.
No promises.
I wouldn't presume to give orders.
If you're heading to the desert, contact us at the first station out from Mos Ila. Lord Silthar should have a lead on the Czerka base by then.
In the meantime, we've got an artifact to study.
All right. Everyone get the equipment packed. Hael, see to the speeders....
My lord! It's good to see you. Were you able to make contact with the Jawas?
Look at you--you're starting to look like Reclamation Service material, covered in dust like that! Did you track down the Jawas?
They gave me a lockbox from a Czerka transport.
I did.
I found the Jawas. It didn't take much to make them give up this.
They foolishly resisted.
I was able to negotiate for what we needed.
We made a bargain.
Those things should be exterminated. But I retrieved this.
Those creatures are foul.
Looks like a stasis crate--the sort Czerka used to transport samples.
Won't be easy to unseal, but we can peek inside. Keighlah? Run it through the analysis grid.
On it. We'll keep the sensitivity low--don't want to pulverize any artifacts inside.
Definitely something in there. Alien device of some sort--roughly spherical, contained in a Czerka energy field. Blasted odd.
This device... is it what your Czerka records talked about?
Is this our goal?
It's part of the collection, probably. But I had the sense Czerka found something bigger, too.
What about it is "odd"?
Odd?
Should I care?
First pass shows the artifact as over ten thousand years old. Probably distortion... the energy readings are unstable.
Give me a few days to pop it open, and we'll run the scan again.
Be careful when you head out to find the Jawas. This planet's not friendly.
Let's talk to Lord Silthar and get those verbobrains analyzed.
If we're going to find that old Czerka base, we need to start somewhere. Get those droid verbobrains.
Keighlah, I need those water readings. We won't get more supplies without a report.
Sorry, sir. I'll check soon as I can... sand in the gauges.
Blast. Bring in some local technicians, see if they can fix us up while I greet our guests.
Barden Golah, sir. Imperial Reclamation Service.
My lord--Barden Golah, Imperial Reclamation Service.
Captain Barden Golah, Imperial Reclamation Service.
I've run excavations on Ziost, Malachor Two and Nim Drovis--but add a little heat and dust, and we've got nothing but trouble.
Your man at the spaceport said this was a "research center."
I was told to come here.
Not exactly up to standard, but yes, Mos Ila is our base of operations.
Why, Captain--you should have alerted me. You know I enjoy guests.
I want to talk to your leader.
I run the crew's day-to-day activities, but we report... ah.
I'm not interested in your complaints. Why are Imperial troops stationed here?
Watch that "friendly" tone.
You'll have to go through... ah.
Captain Golah and his crew report to me. I am Darth Silthar. They are my hands, digging and scraping where I cannot.
We came to Tatooine to solve a mystery--one of dead men and desert secrets. Not for conquest, but for power.
I've come to Tatooine in the name of Darth Baras.
Greetings, my lord.
I know your master. Perhaps we can find common ground.
I hope we're not in competition, my lord.
I came for a secret, too.
Oh, I very much doubt it. But let us talk, one Sith to another.
I didn't realize this was a Sith operation.
Why are there Sith here?
First Imperials, now Sith Lords. Not the Tatooine I expected.
Wow. Everyone shows up here.
What could the Empire possibly need on this dustball?
Power? On Tatooine?
I, too, once viewed this world as insignificant. No longer.
Your team doesn't look like they could last a day in the wastes.
Is this some kind of joke?
Careful what you say. We've lost many, yes; the captain's brother died in one of the trapped tombs of Dxun....
That was Keighlah's brother, my lord. The maalraas ate his body.
No matter. There is no crew more skilled at this delicate work.
The Empire recently found a damaged shuttle drifting through deep space. It came from a Czerka Corporation research base on Tatooine.
Czerka had Tatooinian artifacts they claimed were "the find of the millennium"--mystery devices with the energy throughput of a sun....
...but a month after the shuttle launch, their research base disappeared. Czerka never came back.
Somewhere in this wasteland is power enough to destroy a world, remake a galaxy.
My team is going to find the Czerka base, and these "artifacts" along with it. We will learn their secrets. Will you join us?
If there's such power to be found here, I will claim it.
I'll seek might anywhere.
Lost artifacts have a certain appeal--when they possess such power.
It will be mine.
If these claims prove real, someone must represent the Empire's interests.
Power belongs to the Empire.
For enough credits, I'll find anything you want.
If you're paying....
Ha! Oh, this is wonderful. Our family is growing, Captain.
If you say so, my lord. Welcome to the team.
Tell me more about Czerka.
What's the Czerka Corporation?
Fools who believe that research and technology are a match for true power. They will not interfere.
Why would you want me to join you?
I'm suspicious.
Because I sense power in you. And I have need of such power.
Now... scattered across the desert, sheltered within caves, live a people called the Sons of Palawa.
They are an exacting and ritualistic tribe, come to Tatooine to test themselves against the elements. A settlement nearby has something we need.
What does this tribe have to do with your expedition?
I'm not following you.
They have a clue. What did you call them, Captain?
Test themselves how?
"Test themselves"?
They pound their fists into sand, drill for water instead of using vaporators... what you'd expect.
Most importantly, the Sons of Palawa possess a clue to Czerka's fate. What did you call them, Captain?
They will cooperate or meet their doom.
We take what we need.
Yes--though their might is considerable, especially as they possess--what was it, Captain?
Experimental battle droids armed with turbolasers, shields and who knows what else.
Czerka droids, no doubt rebuilt by the Sons of Palawa. And the tribals... are not inclined to share.
All right.
Perhaps we can negotiate an exchange.
Can we buy them?
Why can't you claim them yourself?
Go take them, then.
The captain and his crew are not soldiers, alas.
After the Empire took Mos Ila, the Sons of Palawa decided we were invaders. They'll shoot anyone who gets close.
But why should that stop you? If the droids truly are from Czerka, I want their secrets!
Dissect them. Peel the droids' armor and bring the captain their verbobrains. Then they will lead us to the missing Czerka base.
Sorry, but we're handling this business ourselves. No outsiders needed.
